definitions.definition: an area where people live that is outside the centre of a city
definitions.labels: (especially North American English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(informal)(British English, informal)North American English, informal

examples.text: As soon as we can afford it, we'll move to the suburbs.
For a child from the suburbs, a trip to the city was a great adventure.
She's renting in a suburb of Boston.
The middle-class suburbs are growing fast.
the coastal suburbs of the capital

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French suburbe or Latin suburbium, from sub- ‘near to’ + urbs, urb- ‘city’.
